alert.note: Alert for Boyle; Casey; Marion (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion, northeastern Taylor, southwestern Boyle and northwestern Casey Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Lebanon, moving east-northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Boyle, southeastern Marion, northeastern Taylor and northwestern Casey Counties, including the following locations... Peytons Store, Bradfordsville, Ellisburg, Chilton, Forkland, Salleetown, Jacktown and Mitchellsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
